text: Andriy Pavlovych Zahorodniuk (; born 5 December 1976) is a Ukrainian entrepreneur and politician. He was the Minister of Defence of Ukraine from 29 August 2019 to 4 March 2020.Ukrainian Lawmakers Approve Political Novice Honcharuk As Prime Minister, Radio Free Europe (29 August 2019) Ukrainian lawmakers appoint Andriy Taran as new defense minister, UNIAN (4 March 2020) == Biography == Zahorodniuk studied law at the Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv. He also graduated from Warwick University and Oxford University. Zahorodniuk is the CEO of Discovery Drilling Equipment. From 2015 to 2017, Zahorodniuk headed the Reform Project Office at the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. In 2018 he was a member of the Reform Project Office under the Ministry of Defense. Zahorodniuk became an advisor to the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky after Zelensky was elected President in the 2019 Ukrainian presidential election. On 9 July 2019, President Zelensky appointed Zahorodniuk to serve as a Member of the Supervisory Board at Ukroboronprom. 29 August 2019 Zahorodniuk was apointed Minister of Defence in the Honcharuk Government. On 4 March 2020 he was succeded (in this post) by Andriy Taran. In July 2020 Zahorodniuk wife became People's Deputy of Ukraine for Voice, after Svyatoslav Vakarchuk's mandate was prematurely terminated.The CEC recognized the new People's Deputy of the Voice instead of Vakarchuk, Ukrayinska Pravda (8 July 2020) == See also == * Honcharuk Government == References == == External links == * MoD of Ukraine * * Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:Politicians from Kyiv Category:University of Kyiv, Law faculty alumni Category:Alumni of the University of Warwick Category:Alumni of Saïd Business School Category:Ukrainian chief executives Category:21st-century Ukrainian businesspeople Category:Presidential advisors Category:Defence ministers of Ukraine Category:21st-century Ukrainian politicians
